params.name: groupId
params.doc: ID of the group requested to join.

params.name: memberIds
params.doc: IDs of the site members to approve.

docs.summary: Approves requests to join a group.
description:
> **Note:** This function is only relevant for private groups.

The `approvejoinGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a site member's request to join a group is approved.
Only site admins and group admins can approve site member requests to join a group, unless the group setting, `membersCanApprove` is set to `true`.

<!--
> **Note:** If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can approve site member requests to join a group.
-->

examples.title: Approve a request to join a group (dashboard page code)
Approve a request to join a group (export from backend code)
body: export const approveJoinGroupRequests = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (groupId, memberIds) => {

params.name: groupId
params.doc: ID of the group requested to join.

docs.summary: Lists requests to join a group.
description:
> **Note:** This function is only relevant for private groups.

The `listjoinGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 requests to join a group. Sorts by default to `_createdDate` in descending order.
Only site admins and group admins can see requests to join their group. Site members can access their own join requests in their site.

> **Notes:**
<!-- > + If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can see requests to join a group. -->

examples.title: List all requests to join a group (dashboard page code)
List all requests to join a group (export from backend code)
List some requests to join a group using paging options
body: export const listJoinGroupRequests = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (groupId, options) => {

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of join requests.
description: + This function is only relevant for private groups.

+ For `SECRET` groups, only site admins and group admins can query requests to join their group. <!-- However, if the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can query requests to join a group. -->
The `queryjoinGroupRequests()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of all requests to join a group, and returns a [joinGroupRequestsQueryBuilder](#joinGroupRequestsquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](#joinGroupRequestsquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `joinGroupRequestsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `joinGroupRequestsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryjoinGroupRequests()` returns.
The results of the `queryjoinGroupRequests()` function are sorted by `_createdDate` in descending order.
`queryjoinGroupRequests()` runs with this `joinGroupRequestsQueryBuilder` default, which you can override:

The following `joinGroupRequestsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryjoinGroupRequests()`. For a full description of the joinGroupRequests object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#joinGroupRequestsqueryresult/items) property in [`joinGroupRequestsQueryResult`](#joinGroupRequestsqueryresult).

examples.title: Query requests to join a group (dashboard page code)
Query requests to join a group (export from backend code)

params.name: groupId
params.doc: ID of the group requested to join.

docs.summary: Rejects requests to join a group.
description:
> **Note:**  This function is only relevant for private groups.

The `rejectjoinGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the site member's request to join a group is rejected.
Only site admins or group admins can reject site member requests to join the group, unless the group setting, `membersCanApprove` is set to `true`.

<!--
> **Note:** If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can reject site member requests to join a group.
-->

examples.title: Reject a request to join a group (dashboard page code)
body: //    reason: 'This group is for college students only.'
*      "requestDetails": {"rejectionReason": "This group is for college students only."}

examples.title: Reject a request to join a group (export from backend code)
body: *    reason: 'This group is for college students only.'
export const rejectJoinGroupRequests = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (groupId, rejections, options) => {
*      "requestDetails": {"rejectionReason": "This group is for college students only."}

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the request to join a group.

One of:
- `"PENDING"`
- `"APPROVED"`
- `"REJECTED"`

description:
To join a private group, a site member must submit a Join Request, which can be approved or rejected by an admin.
When the request is approved, the site member becomes a group member.

members.name: groupId
members.doc: Group ID for which join request was approved.

members.doc: Approved join group request.

members.doc: Group ID for which join request was cancelled.

members.doc: Rejected join group request.

members.doc: ID of the group requested to join.

members.name: joinGroupRequests
members.doc: Join group requests.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Question ID.

members.name: text
members.doc: Answer text.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items in the current results page.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query.

members.name: futurePlans
members.doc: Plan ids which user have, but they don't allow to join group right now, because they start some time in the future.

members.name: requiredPlans
members.doc: Plan ids which allow user to join the group.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.doc: ID of the group requested to join.

members.name: memberId

members.name: reason
members.doc: Reason the request to join a group was rejected. Text written by the request reviewer that is displayed when the group is rejected (max 1,000 characters).

members.name: rejectionReason
members.doc: Reason the request to join a group was rejected.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: membershipQuestionAnswers
members.doc: Answers to membership questions. They can be empty, but submit join group request will fail if an answer to a required question is omitted.

members.name: violationType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADMIN_APPROVAL'`
- `'ALREADY_JOINED'`
- `'EVENTS'`
- `'MEMBERSHIP_QUESTIONS'`
- `'NONE'`
- `'NOT_LOGGED_IN'`
- `'PRICING_PlANS'`
- `'SECRET_GROUP'`
